Key Match Events: Second-half goals from Ryan Christie and substitute Che Adams earned Scotland victory.
Leeds defender Liam Cooper limped off in the second half, creating a fitness doubt for Scotland.
Scotland missed a series of early chances before finally breaking Gibraltar's resistance.
Ryan Christie scored the first goal from Robertson’s deep cross.
Che Adams volleyed home John McGinn’s cross in the 85th minute.
Post-Match Reflections: Scotland football suffered another Euro 2024 injury scare during a 2-0 warm-up victory over Gibraltar.
The departure of half-time substitute Cooper could give Clarke another headache after losing striker Lyndon Dykes to an ankle injury.
Scotland had gone seven games without a win before the trip to Portugal, a run which included five defeats and was their longest without victory for 19 years.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Clarke handed a debut to Bristol City right-back Ross McCrorie.
James Forrest was back in the Scotland team for the first time since the previous European Championship finals.
Norwich defender Grant Hanley made his first Scotland appearance since the victory over Spain in March 2023 and his first start in any game for three months.
